channel.title: Error running query: Worker exited prematurely: signal 6 (SIGABRT)
channel.description:
Getting our self-hosted instance setup and getting this error on one of the queries. What does it mean and how do we address it?
VM: Linux (ubuntu 18.04) vCPUs: 2 RAM: 4 GiB

item.title: Error running query: Worker exited prematurely: signal 6 (SIGABRT)
item.dc:creator: jesse
item.description:
How much RAM have you allocated for your docker containers? Do you see anything in your logs?

Read full topic
item.source: Error running query: Worker exited prematurely: signal 6 (SIGABRT)

item.title: Error running query: Worker exited prematurely: signal 6 (SIGABRT)
item.dc:creator: dsharp
item.description:
I have another query returning this same error. But, now I have the following:

VM: Linux (ubuntu 18.04)
vCPUs: 4
RAM: 16 GiB
Max IOPS: 6400

Any other suggestions?

Read full topic
item.source: Error running query: Worker exited prematurely: signal 6 (SIGABRT)

item.title: Error running query: Worker exited prematurely: signal 6 (SIGABRT)
item.dc:creator: dsharp
item.description:
That seems to have been the cause. Thanks!

item.source: Error running query: Worker exited prematurely: signal 6 (SIGABRT)

item.title: Error running query: Worker exited prematurely: signal 6 (SIGABRT)
item.dc:creator: jesse
item.description:
Try increasing the RAM on your machine. It sounds like the worker crashed because it ran out of memory.

Read full topic
